availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oliver P. Marshall (Green County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John B. Marshall and Rebecca Marshall. Farmer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Household owned Ann [Unknown], Bluford [Unknown], Bob [Unknown], Charlie [Unknown], Edmund [Unknown], Jorden [Unknown], Joseph [Unknown], Lewis [Unknown], Luelly [Unknown], Matilda [Unknown], Nelson [Unknown], Richard [Unknown], and West [Unknown], in Green County in 1857. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 124B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2.

Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Green County Wills, vol. 1-5, 1796-1939, Will Book 3, pp. 223-226.
